derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from late Latin insurrectio(n-), from insurgere 'rise up'

entry.def: An insurrection is violent action that is taken by a large group of people against the rulers of their country, usually in order to remove them from office.

example.ex: They were plotting to stage an armed insurrection.
example.tran: 他们正密谋发动武装起义。

example.ex: Those found guilty of rebellion and insurrection will be sentenced to life imprisonment.
example.tran: 那些被判决犯有谋反叛乱罪的人将被处以终身监禁。

means.word_mean: 1. organized opposition to authority; a conflict in which one faction tries to wrest control from another
